ca_material.Description: PEM-encoded content of Docker host CA certificate

cert_material.Description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client certificate

cert_path.Description: Path to directory with Docker TLS config

key_material.Description: PEM-encoded content of Docker client private key

config_file.Description: Path to docker json file for registry auth

config_file_content.Description: Plain content of the docker json file for registry auth

ssh_opts.Description: Additional SSH option flags to be appended when using `ssh://` protocol

attach.Description: If `true` attach to the container after its creation and waits the end of its execution. Defaults to `false`.

bridge.Description: The network bridge of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

capabilities.Description: Add or drop certrain linux capabilities.

add.Description: List of linux capabilities to add.

drop.Description: List of linux capabilities to drop.

command.Description: The command to use to start the container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram","-","baz.con"]`.

container_logs.Description: The logs of the container if its execution is done (`attach` must be disabled).

cpu_set.Description: A comma-separated list or hyphen-separated range of CPUs a container can use, e.g. `0-1`.

cpu_shares.Description: CPU shares (relative weight) for the container.

destroy_grace_seconds.Description: If defined will attempt to stop the container before destroying. Container will be destroyed after `n` seconds or on successful stop.

container_path.Description: The path in the container where the device will be bound.

host_path.Description: The path on the host where the device is located.

permissions.Description: The cgroup permissions given to the container to access the device. Defaults to `rwm`.

dns_opts.Description: DNS options used by the DNS provider(s), see `resolv.conf` documentation for valid list of options.

dns_search.Description: DNS search domains that are used when bare unqualified hostnames are used inside of the container.

entrypoint.Description: The command to use as the Entrypoint for the container. The Entrypoint allows you to configure a container to run as an executable. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram` when starting a container, set the entrypoint to be `"/usr/bin/myprogra"]`.

env.Description: Environment variables to set in the form of `KEY=VALUE`, e.g. `DEBUG=0`

exit_code.Description: The exit code of the container if its execution is done (`must_run` must be disabled).

gateway.Description: The network gateway of the container.
gateway.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The network gateway of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

group_add.Description: Additional groups for the container user

healthcheck.Description: A test to perform to check that the container is healthy

interval.Description: Time between running the check (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

retries.Description: Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Defaults to `0`.

start_period.Description: Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

test.Description: Command to run to check health. For example, to run `curl -f localhost/health` set the command to be `["CMD", "curl", "-f", "localhost/health"]`.

timeout.Description: Maximum time to allow one check to run (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

host.Description: Additional hosts to add to the container.

ip.Description: IP address this hostname should resolve to.

image.Description: The ID of the image to back this container. The easiest way to get this value is to use the `docker_image` resource as is shown in the example.

init.Description: Configured whether an init process should be injected for this container. If unset this will default to the `dockerd` defaults.

ip_address.Description: The IP address of the container.
ip_address.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The IP address of the container's first network it.

ip_prefix_length.Description: The IP prefix length of the container.
ip_prefix_length.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The IP prefix length of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

ipc_mode.Description: IPC sharing mode for the container. Possible values are: `none`, `private`, `shareable`, `container:<name|id>` or `host`.

links.Description: Set of links for link based connectivity between containers that are running on the same host.
links.Deprecated: The --link flag is a legacy feature of Docker. It may eventually be removed.

log_driver.Description: The logging driver to use for the container.

log_opts.Description: Key/value pairs to use as options for the logging driver.

logs.Description: Save the container logs (`attach` must be enabled). Defaults to `false`.

max_retry_count.Description: The maximum amount of times to an attempt a restart when `restart` is set to 'on-failure'.

memory.Description: The memory limit for the container in MBs.

memory_swap.Description: The total memory limit (memory + swap) for the container in MBs. This setting may compute to `-1` after `terraform apply` if the target host doesn't support memory swap, when that is the case docker will use a soft limitation.

mounts.Description: Specification for mounts to be added to containers created as part of the service.

bind_options.Description: Optional configuration for the bind type.

propagation.Description: A propagation mode with the value.

read_only.Description: Whether the mount should be read-only.

source.Description: Mount source (e.g. a volume name, a host path).

tmpfs_options.Description: Optional configuration for the tmpfs type.

mode.Description: The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer.

size_bytes.Description: The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

volume_options.Description: Optional configuration for the volume type.

driver_name.Description: Name of the driver to use to create the volume.

driver_options.Description: key/value map of driver specific options.

no_copy.Description: Populate volume with data from the target.

must_run.Description: If `true`, then the Docker container will be kept running. If `false`, then as long as the container exists, Terraform assumes it is successful. Defaults to `true`.

network_alias.Description: Set an alias for the container in all specified networks
network_alias.Deprecated: Use networks_advanced instead. Will be removed in v3.0.0

network_data.Description: The data of the networks the container is connected to.

gateway.Description: The network gateway of the container.
gateway.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The network gateway of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

global_ipv6_address.Description: The IPV6 address of the container.

global_ipv6_prefix_length.Description: The IPV6 prefix length address of the container.

ip_address.Description: The IP address of the container.
ip_address.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The IP address of the container's first network it.

ip_prefix_length.Description: The IP prefix length of the container.
ip_prefix_length.Deprecated: Use `network_data` instead. The IP prefix length of the container as read from its NetworkSettings.

ipv6_gateway.Description: The IPV6 gateway of the container.

networks.Description: ID of the networks in which the container is.
networks.Deprecated: Use networks_advanced instead. Will be removed in v3.0.0

networks_advanced.Description: The networks the container is attached to

aliases.Description: The network aliases of the container in the specific network.

ipv4_address.Description: The IPV4 address of the container in the specific network.

ipv6_address.Description: The IPV6 address of the container in the specific network.

pid_mode.Description: he PID (Process) Namespace mode for the container. Either `container:<name|id>` or `host`.

ports.Description: Publish a container's port(s) to the host.

external.Description: Port exposed out of the container. If not given a free random port `>= 32768` will be used.

ip.Description: IP address/mask that can access this port. Defaults to `0.0.0.0`.

protocol.Description: Protocol that can be used over this port. Defaults to `tcp`.

privileged.Description: If `true`, the container runs in privileged mode.

publish_all_ports.Description: Publish all ports of the container.

read_only.Description: If `true`, the container will be started as readonly. Defaults to `false`.

remove_volumes.Description: If `true`, it will remove anonymous volumes associated with the container. Defaults to `true`.

restart.Description: The restart policy for the container. Must be one of 'no', 'on-failure', 'always', 'unless-stopped'. Defaults to `no`.

rm.Description: If `true`, then the container will be automatically removed when it exits. Defaults to `false`.

security_opts.Description: List of string values to customize labels for MLS systems, such as SELinux. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#security-configuration.

start.Description: If `true`, then the Docker container will be started after creation. If `false`, then the container is only created. Defaults to `true`.

stdin_open.Description: If `true`, keep STDIN open even if not attached (`docker run -i`). Defaults to `false`.

storage_opts.Description: Key/value pairs for the storage driver options, e.g. `size`: `120G`

sysctls.Description: A map of kernel parameters (sysctls) to set in the container.

tmpfs.Description: A map of container directories which should be replaced by `tmpfs mounts`, and their corresponding mount options.

tty.Description: If `true`, allocate a pseudo-tty (`docker run -t`). Defaults to `false`.

upload.Description: Specifies files to upload to the container before starting it. Only one of `content` or `content_base64` can be set and at least one of them has to be set.

content.Description: Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text. Conflicts with `content_base64` & `source`

content_base64.Description: Base64-encoded data that will be decoded and uploaded as raw bytes for the object content. This allows safely uploading non-UTF8 binary data, but is recommended only for larger binary content such as the result of the `base64encode` interpolation function. See [here](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-docker/issues/48#issuecomment-374174588) for the reason. Conflicts with `content` & `source`

executable.Description: If `true`, the file will be uploaded with user executable permission. Defaults to `false`.

file.Description: Path to the file in the container where is upload goes to

source.Description: A filename that references a file which will be uploaded as the object content. This allows for large file uploads that do not get stored in state. Conflicts with `content` & `content_base64`

source_hash.Description: If using `source`, this will force an update if the file content has updated but the filename has not.

user.Description: User used for run the first process. Format is `user` or `user:group` which user and group can be passed literraly or by name.

userns_mode.Description: Sets the usernamespace mode for the container when usernamespace remapping option is enabled.

volumes.Description: Spec for mounting volumes in the container.

container_path.Description: The path in the container where the volume will be mounted.

from_container.Description: The container where the volume is coming from.

host_path.Description: The path on the host where the volume is coming from.

read_only.Description: If `true`, this volume will be readonly. Defaults to `false`.

volume_name.Description: The name of the docker volume which should be mounted.

working_dir.Description: The working directory for commands to run in.

build.Description: Configuration to build an image. Please see [docker build command reference](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/build/#options) too.

dockerfile.Description: Name of the Dockerfile. Defaults to `Dockerfile`.

no_cache.Description: Do not use cache when building the image

remove.Description: Remove intermediate containers after a successful build. Defaults to  `true`.

tag.Description: Name and optionally a tag in the 'name:tag' format

target.Description: Set the target build stage to build

force_remove.Description: If true, then the image is removed forcibly when the resource is destroyed.

keep_locally.Description: If true, then the Docker image won't be deleted on destroy operation. If this is false, it will delete the image from the docker local storage on destroy operation.

latest.Description: The ID of the image in the form of `sha256:<hash>` image digest. Do not confuse it with the default `latest` tag.

name.Description: The name of the Docker image, including any tags or SHA256 repo digests.

output.Deprecated: Is unused and will be removed.

pull_trigger.Description: A value which cause an image pull when changed

pull_triggers.Description: List of values which cause an image pull when changed. This is used to store the image digest from the registry when using the [docker_registry_image](../data-sources/registry_image.md).

repo_digest.Description: The image sha256 digest in the form of `repo[:tag]@sha256:<hash>`.

attachable.Description: Enable manual container attachment to the network.

check_duplicate.Description: Requests daemon to check for networks with same name.

driver.Description: The driver of the Docker network. Possible values are `bridge`, `host`, `overlay`, `macvlan`. See [network docs](https://docs.docker.com/network/#network-drivers) for more details.

ingress.Description: Create swarm routing-mesh network. Defaults to `false`.

aux_address.Description: Auxiliary IPv4 or IPv6 addresses used by Network driver

gateway.Description: The IP address of the gateway

ip_range.Description: The ip range in CIDR form

ipam_driver.Description: Driver used by the custom IP scheme of the network. Defaults to `default`

name.Description: The name of the Docker network.

options.Description: Only available with bridge networks. See [bridge options docs](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/network_create/#bridge-driver-options) for more details.

scope.Description: Scope of the network. One of `swarm`, `global`, or `local`.

enable_timeout.Description: HTTP client timeout to enable the plugin

enabled.Description: If `true` the plugin is enabled. Defaults to `true`

env.Description: The environment variables in the form of `KEY=VALUE`, e.g. `DEBUG=0`

force_destroy.Description: If true, then the plugin is destroyed forcibly

force_disable.Description: If true, then the plugin is disabled forcibly

grant_all_permissions.Description: If true, grant all permissions necessary to run the plugin

build_args.Description: Pairs for build-time variables in the form TODO

build_id.Description: BuildID is an optional identifier that can be passed together with the build request. The same identifier can be used to gracefully cancel the build with the cancel request.

cache_from.Description: Images to consider as cache sources

cgroup_parent.Description: Optional parent cgroup for the container

context.Description: The absolute path to the context folder. You can use the helper function '${path.cwd}/context-dir'.

cpu_period.Description: The length of a CPU period in microseconds

cpu_quota.Description: Microseconds of CPU time that the container can get in a CPU period

cpu_set_cpus.Description: CPUs in which to allow execution (e.g., `0-3`, `0`, `1`)

cpu_set_mems.Description: MEMs in which to allow execution (`0-3`, `0`, `1`)

extra_hosts.Description: A list of hostnames/IP mappings to add to the containers /etc/hosts file. Specified in the form ["hostname:IP"]

isolation.Description: Isolation represents the isolation technology of a container. The supported values are

memory_swap.Description: Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to enable unlimited swap

network_mode.Description: Set the networking mode for the RUN instructions during build

no_cache.Description: Do not use the cache when building the image

platform.Description: Set platform if server is multi-platform capable

pull_parent.Description: Attempt to pull the image even if an older image exists locally

remote_context.Description: A Git repository URI or HTTP/HTTPS context URI

remove.Description: Remove intermediate containers after a successful build (default behavior)

session_id.Description: Set an ID for the build session

shm_size.Description: Size of /dev/shm in bytes. The size must be greater than 0

squash.Description: If true the new layers are squashed into a new image with a single new layer

suppress_output.Description: Suppress the build output and print image ID on success

target.Description: Set the target build stage to build

version.Description: Version of the underlying builder to use

insecure_skip_verify.Description: If `true`, the verification of TLS certificates of the server/registry is disabled. Defaults to `false`

keep_remotely.Description: If true, then the Docker image won't be deleted on destroy operation. If this is false, it will delete the image from the docker registry on destroy operation. Defaults to `false`

name.Description: The name of the Docker image.

sha256_digest.Description: The sha256 digest of the image.

auth.Description: Configuration for the authentication for pulling the images of the service

server_address.Description: The address of the server for the authentication

converge_config.Description: A configuration to ensure that a service converges aka reaches the desired that of all task up and running

delay.Description: The interval to check if the desired state is reached `(ms|s)`. Defaults to `7s`.

timeout.Description: The timeout of the service to reach the desired state `(s|m)`. Defaults to `3m`

endpoint_spec.Description: Properties that can be configured to access and load balance a service

mode.Description: The mode of resolution to use for internal load balancing between tasks

ports.Description: List of exposed ports that this service is accessible on from the outside. Ports can only be provided if 'vip' resolution mode is used

name.Description: A random name for the port

protocol.Description: Rrepresents the protocol of a port: `tcp`, `udp` or `sctp`. Defaults to `tcp`.

publish_mode.Description: Represents the mode in which the port is to be published: 'ingress' or 'host'. Defaults to `ingress`.

published_port.Description: The port on the swarm hosts

global.Description: The global service mode. Defaults to `false`

replicas.Description: The amount of replicas of the service. Defaults to `1`

rollback_config.Description: Specification for the rollback strategy of the service

delay.Description: Delay between task rollbacks (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

failure_action.Description: Action on rollback failure: pause | continue. Defaults to `pause`.

max_failure_ratio.Description: Failure rate to tolerate during a rollback. Defaults to `0.0`.

monitor.Description: Duration after each task rollback to monitor for failure (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `5s`.

order.Description: Rollback order: either 'stop-first' or 'start-first'. Defaults to `stop-first`.

parallelism.Description: Maximum number of tasks to be rollbacked in one iteration. Defaults to `1`

command.Description: The command/entrypoint to be run in the image. According to the [docker cli](https://github.com/docker/cli/blob/v20.10.7/cli/command/service/opts.go#L705) the override of the entrypoint is also passed to the `command` property and there is no `entrypoint` attribute in the `ContainerSpec` of the service.

configs.Description: References to zero or more configs that will be exposed to the service

config_id.Description: ID of the specific config that we're referencing

config_name.Description: Name of the config that this references, but this is just provided for lookup/display purposes. The config in the reference will be identified by its ID

file_gid.Description: Represents the file GID. Defaults to `0`.

file_mode.Description: Represents represents the FileMode of the file. Defaults to `0o444`.

file_name.Description: Represents the final filename in the filesystem

file_uid.Description: Represents the file UID. Defaults to `0`.

dir.Description: The working directory for commands to run in

dns_config.Description: Specification for DNS related configurations in resolver configuration file (`resolv.conf`)

nameservers.Description: The IP addresses of the name servers

options.Description: A list of internal resolver variables to be modified (e.g., `debug`, `ndots:3`, etc.)

search.Description: A search list for host-name lookup

env.Description: A list of environment variables in the form VAR="value"

groups.Description: A list of additional groups that the container process will run as

healthcheck.Description: A test to perform to check that the container is healthy

interval.Description: Time between running the check (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

retries.Description: Consecutive failures needed to report unhealthy. Defaults to `0`

start_period.Description: Start period for the container to initialize before counting retries towards unstable (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

test.Description: The test to perform as list

timeout.Description: Maximum time to allow one check to run (ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `0s`.

hostname.Description: The hostname to use for the container, as a valid RFC 1123 hostname

hosts.Description: A list of hostname/IP mappings to add to the container's hosts file

image.Description: The image name to use for the containers of the service, like `nginx:1.17.6`. Also use the data-source or resource of `docker_image` with the `repo_digest` or `docker_registry_image` with the `name` attribute for this, as shown in the examples.

isolation.Description: Isolation technology of the containers running the service. (Windows only). Defaults to `default`.

mounts.Description: Specification for mounts to be added to containers created as part of the service

bind_options.Description: Optional configuration for the bind type

propagation.Description: Bind propagation refers to whether or not mounts created within a given bind-mount or named volume can be propagated to replicas of that mount. See the [docs](https://docs.docker.com/storage/bind-mounts/#configure-bind-propagation) for details. Defaults to `rprivate`

read_only.Description: Whether the mount should be read-only

source.Description: Mount source (e.g. a volume name, a host path)

tmpfs_options.Description: Optional configuration for the tmpfs type

mode.Description: The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer

size_bytes.Description: The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes

volume_options.Description: Optional configuration for the volume type

driver_name.Description: Name of the driver to use to create the volume

driver_options.Description: key/value map of driver specific options

no_copy.Description: Populate volume with data from the target

credential_spec.Description: CredentialSpec for managed service account (Windows only)

file.Description: Load credential spec from this file

registry.Description: Load credential spec from this value in the Windows registry

read_only.Description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only

secrets.Description: References to zero or more secrets that will be exposed to the service

file_gid.Description: Represents the file GID. Defaults to `0`

file_mode.Description: Represents represents the FileMode of the file. Defaults to `0o444`

file_name.Description: Represents the final filename in the filesystem

file_uid.Description: Represents the file UID. Defaults to `0`

secret_id.Description: ID of the specific secret that we're referencing

secret_name.Description: Name of the secret that this references, but this is just provided for lookup/display purposes. The config in the reference will be identified by its ID

stop_grace_period.Description: Amount of time to wait for the container to terminate before forcefully removing it (ms|s|m|h). If not specified or '0s' the destroy will not check if all tasks/containers of the service terminate.

force_update.Description: A counter that triggers an update even if no relevant parameters have been changed. See the [spec](https://github.com/docker/swarmkit/blob/master/api/specs.proto#L126).

log_driver.Description: Specifies the log driver to use for tasks created from this spec. If not present, the default one for the swarm will be used, finally falling back to the engine default if not specified

options.Description: The options for the logging driver

networks.Description: Ids of the networks in which the  container will be put in

max_replicas.Description: Maximum number of replicas for per node (default value is `0`, which is unlimited)

platforms.Description: Platforms stores all the platforms that the service's image can run on

prefs.Description: Preferences provide a way to make the scheduler aware of factors such as topology. They are provided in order from highest to lowest precedence, e.g.: `spread=node.role.manager`

resources.Description: Resource requirements which apply to each individual container created as part of the service

limits.Description: Describes the resources which can be advertised by a node and requested by a task

memory_bytes.Description: The amounf of memory in bytes the container allocates

nano_cpus.Description: CPU shares in units of `1/1e9` (or `10^-9`) of the CPU. Should be at least `1000000`

reservation.Description: An object describing the resources which can be advertised by a node and requested by a task

generic_resources.Description: User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, `SSD=3`) or String resources (e.g, GPU=UUID1)

memory_bytes.Description: The amounf of memory in bytes the container allocates

nano_cpus.Description: CPU shares in units of 1/1e9 (or 10^-9) of the CPU. Should be at least `1000000`

restart_policy.Description: Specification for the restart policy which applies to containers created as part of this service.

max_attempts.Description: Maximum attempts to restart a given container before giving up (default value is `0`, which is ignored)

window.Description: The time window used to evaluate the restart policy (default value is `0`, which is unbounded) (ms|s|m|h)

runtime.Description: Runtime is the type of runtime specified for the task executor. See the [types](https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/api/types/swarm/runtime.go).

update_config.Description: Specification for the update strategy of the service

delay.Description: Delay between task updates `(ns|us|ms|s|m|h)`. Defaults to `0s`.

failure_action.Description: Action on update failure: `pause`, `continue` or `rollback`. Defaults to `pause`.

max_failure_ratio.Description: Failure rate to tolerate during an update. Defaults to `0.0`.

monitor.Description: Duration after each task update to monitor for failure (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Defaults to `5s`.

order.Description: Update order: either 'stop-first' or 'start-first'. Defaults to `stop-first`.

parallelism.Description: Maximum number of tasks to be updated in one iteration. Defaults to `1`

driver.Description: Driver type for the volume. Defaults to `local`.

name.Description: The name of the Docker volume (will be generated if not provided).
The name of the Docker image, including any tags or SHA256 repo digests.

repo_digest.Description: The image sha256 digest in the form of `repo[:tag]@sha256:<hash>`. It may be empty in the edge case where the local image was pulled from a repo, tagged locally, and then referred to in the data source by that local name/tag.

driver.Description: The driver of the Docker network. Possible values are `bridge`, `host`, `overlay`, `macvlan`. See [network docs](https://docs.docker.com/network/#network-drivers) for more details.

aux_address.Description: Auxiliary IPv4 or IPv6 addresses used by Network driver

gateway.Description: The IP address of the gateway

ip_range.Description: The ip range in CIDR form

name.Description: The name of the Docker network.

options.Description: Only available with bridge networks. See [bridge options docs](https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/network_create/#bridge-driver-options) for more details.

scope.Description: Scope of the network. One of `swarm`, `global`, or `local`.

alias.Description: The alias of the Docker plugin. If the tag is omitted, `:latest` is complemented to the attribute value.

env.Description: The environment variables in the form of `KEY=VALUE`, e.g. `DEBUG=0`

grant_all_permissions.Description: If true, grant all permissions necessary to run the plugin

id.Description: The ID of the plugin, which has precedence over the `alias` of both are given

name.Description: The plugin name. If the tag is omitted, `:latest` is complemented to the attribute value.

insecure_skip_verify.Description: If `true`, the verification of TLS certificates of the server/registry is disabled. Defaults to `false`

name.Description: The name of the Docker image, including any tags. e.g. `alpine:latest`

sha256_digest.Description: The content digest of the image, as stored in the registry.
